headline: Dry Onion Soup Mix
description: Whip up onion soup mix using dry ingredients you may already have in your pantry. This is an easy homemade substitute to store-bought for soup or dip.
name: Dry Onion Soup Mix

recipeInstructions.text: Stir onion flakes, beef bouillon granules, onion powder, parsley flakes, celery seed, paprika, and black pepper together in a bowl.
Use as a substitute for a 1-ounce envelope of dry onion soup mix.

review.reviewBody: Amazing recipe! For movie night, add a couple table spoons of this to 2-3 cups of sour cream for an easy onion dip!

I made it as is and it was wonderful. I like it so much that I’m going to make this every time I need that onion soup mix. Because I don’t like eating chemicals. I just went online and bought a big package of organic minced dried onion on Vitacost so that I have plenty of the dried onions on hand.
Worked great!

I tried the first time as written, but the celery seed seemed to over power the dip. I adjusted the amount of celery seed by half this time, perfect! Use some of the boxed variety the other day. Nearly choked on the amount of salt in it and not very "oniony". This is my go-to recipe forever.

I'm gluten-free, but sometimes want to make recipes which use purchased spice mixes. I am forever grateful to those who have attempted to duplicate these spice mixes so that I may make my own. Thank you for sharing.
Looking forward to using this mix
I've been using this recipe for years and my family loves it. We've used it with beef and pork roasts.
I used it in my meatloaf recipe. Very good!!

I love this recipe! The celery seed is the secret ingredient that gives it that flavor you can’t place but is noticeable when it’s missing. 
I can’t do premade mix because of the salt content so this is my go to for anything requiring onion soup mix. It’s great in White Castle slider copycats.
Thank you for this recipe!!

I needed onion soup mix and didn’t have any so decided to try this one. I only had minced onion so 1/4 cup was a bit too much so will half that next time unless I get onion flakes. This was so much better than the bought mixes. It had more flavour and way less salty. Thanks for sharing this one.
Fantastic!
This recipe is Perfect for making low sodium onion dip! This is going to become a staple in our home. Thank You!

This was a perfect recipe to make on the fly! One of my Thanksgiving recipes called for an onion soup packet and I definitely couldn’t find that on our shelves during this crazy season of 2020. I had all of these ingredients in my cabinet and the flavor was excellent. I’m looking forward to making this again to have tablespoons available on hand.

My 4 children love this recipe for our stew night. My wife is Gluten Free and is very careful. The only change I made was to add garlic powder. Did that for my stew recipe. for the bullion, I used "Better Than Bullion" beef as its flavor is superb and it dilutes easily in water. This recipe is well worth it if onion soup mix is a staple in you home.
I now make this in place of french onion soup packets for recipes. This is a great susbitute
My husband hates onions so he doesn’t even want onion flakes. By making this I could just omit the onion flakes and still have the dry soup mix I needed for another recipe. It turned out wonderfully!
I used this in turkey burgers. Used 1 tsp. of Better than Bouillon beef flavor instead of bouillon To cut back on the salt. My husband LOVED it. Thanks for the recipe!
Very nice mix.
Really good recipe. I made it to mix with sour cream and make onion dip. It is as good or better than Lipton's onion soup mix but much less sodium.
I'll probably never buy the prepared stuff again.
I use this instead of the envelope of soup mix to make Marie's Pot Roast and it comes out great!
Loved it. Used it in a recipe that called for Lipton onion soup mix. Tasted just as good if not better.

I used Epicure toasted onion and Epicure Beef Broth (dry). I left out the onion powder. Used it in a chicken recipe that called for dry onion soup mix. I’m crossing that product off my grocery list. This is MUCH better!
Did exactly what it promised to. I only subbed smoked paprika in place of the standard.

As many other reviewers, Lipton soup mix used to be a staple but because I have an allergy to MSG, which is in Lipton's soup mix and the ranch packets, I had to find 'make-your-own' options. This is an ideal substitute. I also didn't have beef boullion but didn't need it for the recipe I had. However for french onion soup and others that need salt, make sure to add it. I couldn't find beef granules and just chopped up a cube of beef boullion. Worked fine. Definitely a keeper!
I had to leave out the celery seed as I had none nor any celery but this worked perfect for a beef stew recipe calling for a dry onion soup mix. Thank you. Will use over and over
I love this recipe. I add Ground Cumin to my recipe

We were looking for a substitute for commercial dry onion soup mix and were excited to come across this recipe.

We used this recipe in our Homemade Hamburgers and they were delicious!! This recipe is definitely a KEEPER for so many different recipes!!
Easy and taste just like store bought onion soup.
Perfect, no changes needed!
Good
This is so much better than pre-packaged soup mix!
It was a pretty potent mix, not what I expected. I was looking for more of a Lipton's-type soup to use in recipes.
I used this in a pot roast recipe. I skipped the beef granules as I was using beef stock anyway, but otherwise I followed the recipe exactly and it was perfect!
This is the 2nd time I used this recipe except I used fresh onion instead. It is great I use it when I make crockpot Mississippi pot roast it's delicious.
I keep this on hand at all times. I even have my friends using this instead of the high salt expensive packets at the grocery store.
My husband and I both agreed it needed salt.
I added 1/4 tsp granulated garlic and 1/8 tsp of cayenne pepper.
Perfect! I was looking for a DIY version since I recently had to go gluten free and both the Lipton and store brand mixes contained gluten. I love making onion dip with this mix and Greek yogurt.

Love that it is so low in sodium, great for gluten-free, and can easily be made vegan by subbing vegetable bullion for beef! I'm going to experiment with adding beans, etc. so I use this as the base for a dried soup mix to give as gifts next Christmas.
Worked perfectly for a substitute for dry onion soup mix for potatoes. Glad I found it!

I too will never again buy store bought packages, this is better!
I always make our slow cooker pot roast with the soup mix and I was out of the packages. Allrecipes to the rescue once again. I now make a better dry taco mix and dry Italian salad dressing mix all from this site as well. Thank you Faye for sharing this great recipe to add to my dry mix collection..

I can’t tell you how much money this is saving me! I use onion soup mix in my hamburgers, on crockpot roasts, I use it in many recipes. This is spot on. I won’t change a thing. It’s easy and quick. Thank You so much!!!!
Great replacement!

Made really good roasted onion potatoes! I didn’t have bouillon granules on hand, so I used a mallet to smash 4 cubes and it worked fine. It was a bit on the salty side, so I might try the celery seed someone suggested in lieu of the celery salt next time. Overall better than the packets you buy.

I substituted for a couple of items on the list that I didn't have and it still came out great. I've never made my own onion soup mix, but I like that it can be adjusted to fit my taste. This is a great starting point though.
I used Herbox sodium free beef bouillon to make the recipe sodium free, very good!

Did not have beef bouillon, celery seed, or paprika so had to substitute with smoky Montreal steak seasoning...and it still turned out fabulous! I can only imagine how much better it will be with all the listed ingredients... ;)

Wow! Great combo! Love the tanginess. I didn’t have onion powder, so I used garlic powder. Substituted chicken bouillon cubes for beef. Will be using this mix for all kinds of things! Potatoes, chicken, fish, meat. Really versatile mix!

All ingredients were in my pantry with the exception of beef bouillon crystals. I was cooking a beef roast with a mushroom and onion soup sauce so it was simple to add liquid beef bouillon to the can of mushroom soup to replace the crystals. The flavor was great and without the added salt from the dry onion soup mix. I would definitely use this again.
I ran out of onion soup mix and used this instead. It was perfect!

This is my go to when I'm making a French onion dip, or recipes that call for it. I usually increase garlic and onion in everything, or add it if it wasn't called for, this was no exception. I've been using this recipe for years, subbing chicken bouillon for beef, since thats the only one I can find around here without MSG. I never use it in roasts, as most seem to, but I have my own reliable go to for doing roasts that doesn't require any measuring. :) And it uses similar ingredients.
I made it, because I needed something without Cornstarch, because of allergies. It made a chip and dip, just like the Lipton's Onion Soup mix! Tastes great!
This is just fantastic as written. No changes necessary.. 2nd batch made now as we use this quite frequently. If you like Lipton Onion soup, you’ll like this recipe.

This was perfect. I went to use a packet of onion soup mix and realized I was out so I went looking online to see if I could make it and here it was, This did the trick. I won't be buying those packets anymore. Thank you!

Trying to reduced processed foods in our diet so I made this to replace a staple. I was a little worried about the amount of salt in the bouillon but was pleasantly surprised to find this turned out great. Used it on a piece of beef tenderloin in the crockpot and it turned out great! Goodbye Lipton! It has become a staple in our spice cabinet.
Love this !!!

Being gluten free means we can't buy those little packets of goodness. I must say this mix was excellent in the recipe I needed it for: Rempel Family Meatloaf. My only sub in this recipe was the bouillon because I didn't have any on hand. It likely could be omitted, but I chose to use Vegan and Gluten-Free Broth Powder. Can't wait to use this Dry Onion Mix in other recipes! Thank you for the recipe, Faye!

I am giving this a good rating, because the only problem I had with it was my own personal issue. I am posting for those who, like me, cannot have processed soup mix because they contain glutamate (MSG, MAG, Hydrolyzed Soy Protein, etc.) and cause migraines and other health problems in people who are sensitive to it. This recipe calls for dried bouillon granules. I was unable to find such a thing without glutamate in any store.
worked great.. might do this from now on... you know all of the ingredients.. no surprises!
Very good, great substitute and without the insane amount of sodium in Lipton soup mix. Exactly what I wanted and super tasty. Will make this again for sure.
Great recipe! I used this for salisbury steak and a pot roast. It worked beautifully and is such a better alternative to buying the packets. Hubby said it was the best pot roast he ever ate.

Wow! Just perfect! I've been trying to stay away from Liptons opinion soup mix because the sodium is astronomical and it has things in it I really don't care to eat. I am thrilled how this recipe tasted and I actually had to add salt to my meal. Great authentic flavor and I will be using this from now on. Thank you for sharing this recipe!

I always do roast in the crockpot with onion soup mix, cream of mushroom soup and some red wine. Late one Sunday evening (I was cooking it overnight for a pot luck the next day.) I realized I was out of the onion soup mix. I looked up this recipe, added the ingredients with the soup and wine, and it was the best ever!

Super easy, took only 2 minutes to throw together. Smelled just like Lipton soup mix, dinner tasted the same as when I use the Lipton--and saved me a 20-mile roundtrip to the store with 2 toddlers for this one item!
really good. I saw one reviewer said she added a beer and some hot pepper flakes. I opted to do the same , and was not disappointed. Probably the best gravy I've made ;)
mixed it in sour cream and it needed salt, but the saltiness of the chips I was dipping made up for it.

It was a wake up call to try and look for low sodium beef flavoring, I thought I was going to be cutting down on the salt content by making my own mix, but my store had several types of beef base, beef bullion, etc.. and all of it had salt as the first ingredient. Still looking, but very happy to have a recipe when I find it.
No changes made. Tasted great.

I didn't make any changes. It was great and will definitely make again. I used it in my crockpot for pork steaks with mushroom soup, white wine and wooster sauce. Wonderful flavour. Thanks for the recipe.

This recipe saved my bacon, er should I say meatloaf, when I discovered that the onion soup mix I thought was in the cupboard was gone. I think I may stop buying the store version and just keep this homemade recipe close at hand. Thanks!
Why spend money on filler ingredients? This is quick, easy and healthier. Thank you!
This was easy to use and really enhanced the dish I was adding it to, without the added preservatives that come in pre-made Onion Soup Mix. Thanks,

This makes the very best onion dip. Everything is easy to have on hand. The packaged soup dip leaves me feeling unwell but this tastes better anyway. I use a scant Tbsp of beef flavored "Better than Bouillon" .
Great substitute for the already made packages. I think I like it better! Thanks! :)

Use caramelized onions instead of dry onion flakes.

I had lots of onions that needed to be used so I caramelized 2 medium onions (per directions on Allrecipes) and eliminated the dry onion flakes and onion powder. It is the best dip mix ever and the family agrees.

I live in Germany and the onion soup mix here is not the same. I use this dry mix for pot roast. It's a perfect dupe. I omit the onion flakes since I use so many onions for my roast. And also it's hard to find low sodium anything here. So I use normal beef bouillon powder. Sometimes I play with the ratios of parsley and paprika...but the recipe is great as is.
I definitely use this again!
I am also gluten free! And my Mike can't have salt because he is on dialysis! So would deffenitly try this mix.

This was PERFECT!! A lifesaver! I was making No-Peek Beef Tips for company today and discovered that I was out of onion soup mix, which I usually have on hand. I found this recipe and made it exactly as written, except that my beef bouillon was not low sodium, as called for in the recipe. I was holding my breath, hoping the finished dish wouldn't be too salty. It wasn't too salty at all. I will definitely make this again. Thanks for coming to my rescue!
Yes, will make it again!
Needed this when i ran out of tbe bought ready packages. Thought this was excellent !
just great. only had those dried onion strings, crumbled those, and overall a great sub when you need the onion soup mix and don't want to go to the store. VERY GOOD.
Great recipe, with ingredients I always have on hand! I will never buy Lipton Onion Soup Mix again.
This is very close to store bought onion soup mix but it is more potent. We use less as it can get very salty so in this case less is more.
So easy and yummy! I use this in my pot roast recipe and everyone keeps asking what my secret ingredient is!! Will keep making again and again!
Just made this and it's perfect. Much better than store bought.

This is AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME 
It worked so wonderfully. I am thrilled to have a recipe with no MSG and preservatives!!! Dry Onion Soup mix is such a "go to". I even had to use Beef Stock when I didn't have any dry bouillion or dry stock base. It worked wonderfully in that particular recipe.
YUMMY
Love being able to make my own mix and not have to get store bought
This was great. I checked the ingredients on a packet of onion soup mix. MSG listed first on one brand! This tasted great. I used smoked paprika.

I was making a vegetable soup which called for one packet of onion soup mix. I was SURE I had one so I didn't put it on the grocery list. Then I found this recipe and it turned out to be a perfect substitution!
I keep this mix in a jar in my pantry. It is so much better and cheaper than buying it. I will never buy the packages again!

Sent my husband to the store for Lipton Onion soup mix to add to my Pot Roast, he came home with Cup o Noodle! Found this recipe and made it myself, it's a really good match and less sodium, very happy!
I grew up using Lipton's to season everything. Since my Celiac's diagnosis, everything tastes wrong-- until now.I would hug you if I could. This is that good.

I LOVE this! I am gluten intolerant so I use gluten free bullion and make this up in bulk to keep in my pantry. I've been using it for a couple of years and my cooking just wouldn't be the same without it! It is a life saver!
Easy to make. 2 Tbsp of this mix equals 1 1-ounce packet of onion soup mix. Delicious!

I needed to make a dip so I used this recipe and substituted celery seed for celery salt and instead of dried minced onion I caramelized one onion. I mixed it all with vegan sour cream (my husband's allergic to milk) and it came out fantastic! It's the first onion dip he's ever had and he loved it! Thanks!
